{{Primary sources|date=January 2009}}{{Notability|date=January 2009}} {{Infobox software | name = Adept | logo = [[Image:Adept-logo.svg|50px]] | screenshot = [[Image:Adept Manager screenshot.png|250px|]] | caption = A Screenshot of Adept 2.1.3 for KDE 3 | collapsible = | author = Peter RoÄkai | developer = Peter RoÄkai | released = | latest release version = 2.1.3 [KDE 3] | latest release date = {{release date and age|2007|06|27}} | latest preview version = 3 (beta 7.2) [KDE 4] | latest preview date = {{release date and age|2010|02|05}} | programming language = [[Qt (toolkit)|Qt]] | operating system = [[Linux]] | platform = [[KDE]] | size = | language = [[English language|English]] | status = Discontinued | genre = [[Package management]] | license = [[BSD License]] | website = [http://web.mornfall.net/adept.html web.mornfall.net/adept.html] }}
'''Adept Manager''' is a [[graphical user interface]] to the [[Advanced Packaging Tool]] for [[KDE]]. It was developed by Peter RoÄkai and was sponsored by [[Canonical Ltd.]] through the [[Kubuntu]] project, where it replaced the Kynaptic package manager.
Adept 2 is for KDE 3. The last stable release was 2.1.3. Adept 3 is for KDE 4. At the end of 2008 development was discontinued, except for bug fixes, as Adept was replaced by [[KPackageKit]] for [[Kubuntu#Releases|Kubuntu's 9.04]] release.<ref>[http://web.mornfall.net/blog/farewell__44___adept.html "farewell, adept"], notice on the project website. December 17, 2008.</ref> Adept, however, can still be installed from the Debian Testing, Debian Unstable and Ubuntu 9.04, 9.10, 10.04 and 10.10 repositories. Bug fixes are still done to Adept, but major work has been discontinued.
== Features ==
Features of Adept include:
* Downloading and installing software using [[Software repository|repositories]] * Uninstalling software * Updating software and the operating system * Managing repositories * Managing [[GNU Privacy Guard|GPG]] keys for secure repositories * Filtering package lists
== See also == * [[KPackage]] * [[Synaptic Package Manager]] {{Portal|Free software}}
==External links== * [http://web.mornfall.net/adept.html Project homepage]
